author: Amar K
title: A cozy boutique hotel
text:
I liked this hotel because it was small, cozy and comfortable, and centrally located close to Time Square. It also had much better ambiance than chain hotels.
My three suggestions for improvement would be:
1. Provide complimentary water. If your room rate is US$250 per night, don't charge your guests $9 for a bottle of Fiji water in the room, especially since the hotel is a bit old and the tap water probably not healthy to drink.
2. There is an excellent diner next door with a 4-star TripAdvisor rating. Suggest you price your hotel's breakfast accordingly, or better still include it in your room rate. I had a great breakfast next door at the diner for $10.
3. The shower is a bit of a trickle. Would have been nicer to have been able to shower with a better water flow.
Notwithstanding the above, I did like this hotel and do recommend it.
